tools.general
Class MimeMagic

java.lang.Object
  tools.general.MimeMagic

public class MimeMagic
extends java.lang.Object

Class trying to extract MIME type and encoding for given content
Provides a simple implementation of MimeMagic function based on magic.mime used by UNIX file command and Apache MimeMagic module
TODO: support all operators (only EQUALS supported for now) TODO: implements ENCODING if provided in magic.mime file

Author:
Karel MITTIG

extractHtmlEncoding

public static java.lang.String extractHtmlEncoding(java.lang.String content)
Extract charset encoding from HTML/XHTML file
Search for meta tag in head defining content charset

Parameters:
content - the (X)HTML content
Returns:
encoding in head if defined and valid, or UTF-8 for HTML v4.x and above, or ISO-8859-1 for HTML <4.x

Parameters:

Returns:
encoding defined in XML definition, or UTF-8 as default

Detect charset encoding using HTTP Content type and content

Parameters:
contenttype - HTTP Content type
content - Request/Response body
Returns:
Detected charset, or ISO-8859-1 as RFC 2616 default encoding

detectMime

public static java.lang.String detectMime(java.lang.String contenttype,
                                          java.lang.String url,
                                          ExtendedByteArrayOutputStream data,
                                          boolean trustServerPerDefault)
Detect MIME type using MimeMagic, or file extension if available If nothing is founded, trust content type provided in response

Parameters:
contenttype - HTTP content type header
url - requested URL
data - response data
trustServerPerDefault - Trust server for unknown types or not
Returns:
founded MIME type, or value initially provided in contenttype if no content type can be determined

detectMime

                                          java.lang.String url,
                                          java.nio.ByteBuffer data,
                                          boolean trustServerPerDefault)
Detect MIME type using MimeMagic, or file extension if available If nothing is founded, trust content type provided in response

Parameters:
contenttype - HTTP content type header
url - requested URL
data - response data
trustServerPerDefault - Trust server for unknown types or not
Returns:
founded MIME type, or value initially provided in contenttype if no content type can be determined

                                          ExtendedByteArrayOutputStream data)
Detect MIME type using MimeMagic then file extension

Parameters:
url - requested URL
data - Byte stream containing request/response data
Returns:
founded MIME type, or "application/octet-stream" if it cannot be determined

                                          byte[] data)
Detect MIME type using MimeMagic then file extension

Parameters:
url - requested URL or file name
data - byte array containing content to analyze
Returns:
founded MIME type, or "application/octet-stream" if it cannot be determined

Return number of bytes used to computes magic

Returns:
number of bytes

setMagicBytesSize

public static void setMagicBytesSize(int magicbytessize)
Set number of bytes to use for magic detection Lowest value is 8, higher is 4096 (default: 128)

Parameters:
magicbytessize - The bytes to parse for magic
